characters: KILLER TWO... CLIMBING INTO THE MOUTH FROM THE CEMENT BOX
UNMARKED. WE PULL BACK TO SEE THE FULL, PRISTINE BMW GLID
TIGHT ON DAVID AND AMY'S FEET...
THE FACES OF DAVID AND AMY...
ARCHIVE NEWS FOOTAGE... VERY REAL AND AUTHENTIC.
DOWN A DARK STRETCH OF ROAD.
...THAT SAME CALIFORNIA LICENSE PLATE. ONLY IT'S SMOOTH A
CRUCIFIXES AND RABBITS FEET... DRIVERS LICENSES OF VARIOU

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIVE NEWS FOOTAGE... VERY REAL AND AUTHENTIC.
dialogues.text: An AERIAL SHOT THROUGH THE LENS OF A TV NEWS CAMERA... ...of a structure... a roadside motel, sitting along a si road, surrounded by a vast, empty, brown wasteland. The image trembles... the 0.S. RUMBLE OF HELICOPTER BLADES WHIRLING. SEVERAL NEWS VANS, POLICE CARS, AND AMBULANCES are parked around the motel... PEOPLE mil about the scene. Behind the motel, a BACK-HOE tears into the ground. COPS circle the back-hoe, digging with shovels.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is a live shot of the Prairie View Motel, in the eastern side of McKinley County. We've been told police have been working out here for several hours, but the details we're getting from them are sketchy at best. What we do know is that they've borrowed some equipment from a local farmer, and started digging in the rear of the property. What they're looking for though, we're not exactly sure. The camera shot shakily zooms in on the back-hoe, as the machine drags its teeth out of the earth... raises into t air... and a DIRT-COVERED CORPSE HANGS FROM THE METAL CLA

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Oh, God!

dialogues.speaker: HAND-HELD FOOTAGE...
dialogues.text: ...floating among the swarm of media... not really part o this circus... just observing it... weaving in and out of chaos... momentarily holding on a MALE REPORTER standing outside a motel room door. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: The best we can come up with is that some video tapes have been discovered that are somehow connected to the bodies the Sheriff's Department has found buried on the property. As the reporter continues, our POV drifts to the MOTEL RO DOORWAY... the door just hanging on its hinges... furnitu inside SCATTERED ABOUT... BLOODSTAINS ON THE GROUND OUTSI THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: MALE REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Obviously they're being very tight- lipped with details at this stage, so we don't know yet the content of the tapes. Our POV floats to MASKED PARAMEDICS CARRYING BODY BAGS pa FEMALE REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: I've been told all the videos discovered are extremely violent and graphic. Our POV follows the paramedics past the female reporter.. over a BLOODHOUND stretching its leash to claw at the dir as if something's buried just beneath it... we continue t NEWS VAN. The side doors have been slid open, and POLICE crowd around the video equipment inside.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The police are actually using our Channel Nine truck to view what they believe is the most recently recorded tape. We glide over another REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: The images I saw on tape are horrific... unimaginable. The POV turns... to the back of the McKinley County SHERI being interviewed by a NEWSWOMAN for a television camera beyond them.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Sheriff, can you give us an idea of how many bodies have been found? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: As of about a half-hour ago, we were at twenty-seven. But we haven't covered much ground yet.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: So you expect to find more?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so, yes. Our POV drifts past a SMALL PILE OF FULL BODYBAGS...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER
dialogues.text: And the vehicle that was found here... the BMW. ...and stops on a WRECKED BMW sitting beside the motel. W TIGHTEN ON THE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We ran a check on the car. It's registered to a David and Amy Fox, age 29 and 28, respectively. WE PAN DOWN TO THE DENTED CALIFORNIA LICENSE PLATE... hol it for a beat, as...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE REPORTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Can you tell us if they're related to any of this? As the female reporter's voice fades, we...

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'd rather not say at this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVID FOX, (29), bloodshot eyes glazed over from a full d of driving, sits behind the wheel. AMY FOX, (28), sleeps the passenger seat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And you need to think about the families before you start reading off names on air like that. David shakes his head, trying to loosen the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The middle of the night in the middle of nowhere. An endl span of empty rolling hills, dissected by a two-lane high A raccoon scampers out of the brush to some road-kill at center of the pavement. As the raccoon checks out the quality of the decaying rod a GLOW RISES OVER THE CREST... the BMW zooms up the pavem its lights blinding the animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David catches sight of the raccoon. And his reflexes are little slower than they were thirteen hours ago when he started this trek... but he manages to jerk the wheel... car vaults sideways. Amy's tossed out of her slumber, snaps awake with a painf start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW's tires squeal past the raccoon, just inches away They tear through the high grass... bounce over a rock... a ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David pulls the car out of the ditch and back onto the ro He steadies the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! He glances in the rearview... sees the raccoon shuffle ba into the brush. David looks at Amy. She's staring back at him, not as hap as the raccoon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There was a raccoon in the middle of the road.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Better to kill us than get a little road-kill on the new car, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're still alive, Amy. I can tell by the pissy look you're giving me. Amy rolls her eyes, wipes the sleep from her face, grabs bottle of water and takes a drink before looking out the window at the passing bushes.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This isn't the interstate, David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Taking a shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Through where?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: New Mexico I think. Maybe Arizona. Same place really. A FAINT 0.S. CLANK from under the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hear wha... David holds up his hand, quieting Amy. He strains to list to the engine.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I think the engine made a noise. Amy throws a glance at the clock. It reads, "1:25".

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It's kind of late for a breakdown. You should have stopped somewhere earlier. David doesn't hear anything else... shrugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I popped some of those trucker pills back in Texas. Thought I could make it all the way.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes to get this trip over with as quickly as possible. Amy turns back to the window. David stares straight ahead There's not much love in this car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You want a snack or something? There are some chips left in the back.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Amy pulls an apple and knife from a bag... cuts a chunk o of the apple. She offers it to David. He shakes his head and she pops it in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You were really dreaming over there earlier. Mumbling and jerking around.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I dreamt you were trying to kill me. We were at my parent's anniversary party, and my mother wouldn't stop talking. You started screaming you couldn't take it anymore, and you tried to strangle me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'd never do that. Although the thought of strangling your mother did cross my mind. (beat) But at least you were dreaming about me, that's an improvement. Go on back to sleep. Maybe next I'll sexually assault you. David grins. Amy doesn't see the joke... just keeps worki on the apple. The knife slices into it... just as the car BOUNCES OVER A POTHOLE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The knife slips off the apple... cuts across Amy's finger

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Shit. Amy sticks her finger into her mouth... tries to suck the pain away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You okay? (off Amy's nod) I keep telling you how stupid that is. Just bite the apple like the rest of the world.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Hurts my teeth.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: As bad as cutting your finger off? Amy tosses the bloody apple and knife back into the bag, checks out the wound. Just a small cut.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It's not anything. She pulls a bandaid from the glove compartment... wraps i around her finger.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want me to drive for a while?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm good. Go on back to sleep. David reaches up and turns on the radio... flips through stations... all the same... STATIC. David digs through his CD wallet... sees one that makes h smile, and pulls it out... slides it into the player THE CHILDREN'S SONG... "Hush Little Baby" begins playing.

dialogues.speaker: SINGING VOICE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: "Hush little baby, don't say a word. Mama's gonna buy you a mockingbird. And if that mockingbird don't sing, Daddy's gonna buy you a diamond ring." Amy hears it... throws an angry glare at David. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why do you have that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess I like to hear it. (off Amy's grunt) You deal your way, Amy, and I'll deal mine, okay?

dialogues.speaker: SINGING VOICE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: "And if that looking glass gets broke, Mama's gonna buy you a..." Amy can't take it anymore... flips the stereo off and tur back toward the darkness of the night.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: At one-thirty in the middle of goddamn nowhere, I'll take whatever I can get.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It's been a year. You should know by now that all we've got left is each other. (beat) And that's not even close to enough. TIGHT ON AMY'S REFLECTION IN THE WINDOW... ...Staring out into the night. She slips her injured fing back into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW glides down the road, its taillights fading into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another stretch of road. If possible, this one seems even more desolate than the last. The BMW moves slowly along the road, making a DEFINITE CLANKING NOISE.  VACANCY 3-23-06 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy has an atlas open in her lap. David taps one of the narrow roads, winding across the page.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That should be us about there.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why didn't you just stay on the interstate?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know, I guess I just wanted to make this as miserable as possible. See just how big a bitch you could be about it. David stares down the road. His angry face softens a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought this would be faster. The GRIND OF METAL ON METAL from under the hood. David grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. Amy squints out through the windshield and points.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Is that something? The glow of a light ahead of them. They drive closer... ...the faded, old fluorescent sign of a service station d into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small, paint-peeled building from the Forties, with a single gas pump sitting out front. There are several LARG FIREWORKS SIGNS hanging along the roof. One of the hand- painted signs reads, “Every day is the Fourth Of July at Small’s”. The BMW cruises past the pump... rolls over a hose that r across the ground. A LOUD RING ERUPTS as the tires bounce over the hose. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The BMW stops beside the pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Amy stare at the old building. Its windows are dark.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Guess they're probably closed.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Since 1957. David glances out at the pump.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Too bad. Good price on gas. They go back to the atlas.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I remember going through that place there... Elida. You were asleep... probably two or three hours ago, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Then that has to put us down here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There's a town... Downey. Gotta be a real car place there.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: If that's really where we are. David glances at the LED COMPASS in the dash.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're headed west. Eventually we have to hit California. Amy shrugs... looks up from the atlas and sees a FACE sta in David's window. She SCREAMS. David spins and sees the face of the garage MECHANIC, (20 good-looking.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David restarts his heart... rolls down his window.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just don't get much business around here. Wanted to make sure I got to you before you left. But I've gotta warn you, the gas price is a little steeper than the sign says.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Actually, we're just having a little engine problem. I dodged a raccoon a few miles back.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: And we're lost.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She's lost. I know right where I am. We're on our way to Downey. David points down the road. The Mechanic nods... tries to subtly motion his head the opposite direction of David's finger. It takes a few times before David catches on. And Amy already has.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: He's trying to tell you it's the other way, David.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sorry. But it's real easy to get turned around out here without a map. Amy holds up their map.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, Downey's about thirty miles back. David ignores Amy's smirk.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you wanna pop the hood, I'll take a look to make sure you'll get that far.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I hate to bother you with it this late. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: It’s no bother at all. David pulls the hood lever, then climbs out with the Mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mechanic starts examining the engine.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I went off the road... with the raccoon. Think I hit a low spot.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Looks like it, yeah. The Mechanic reaches in... tinkers with the engine.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you hit the gas for me? David hurries around the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David climbs in... hits the gas. He and Amy peer under th crack of the open hood, watching the Mechanic's hands mov around the engine... pull a wrench from his pocket... rea back under the hood.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Can he fix it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shrugs, to the Mechanic) What do you think? The Mechanic slams the hood.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Fan blade's bent. Rock musta hit it. She'll still drive fine. Just noisy is all. The Mechanic walks back to David's window. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You might wanna have somebody smarter than me check it when you get where you're goin' though.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'll do that, thanks. What do I owe you?

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: We're good. I should pay you for finally giving me something to do. Now do you need to know how to get back to Downey?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Actually, if you could point us back to the interstate... we're trying to get to California.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: You don't want Downey then. David feels Amy's eyes burning into his back. The Mechanic points down the road.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: About seven miles down, there'll be a road on your right with a grove of trees beside it. Take that and keep goin' till you hit Westcliff. You'll run into a four lane there. Hang a left on that and it'll take you right back where you need to be.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot. David pulls a twenty dollar bill from his pocket and hold out the window.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. This way I won't feel guilty for dragging you out here so late. The Mechanic shrugs... takes the money. Then he reaches i his back pocket... pulls out a sparkler. He flicks his cigarette lighter... ignites the sparkler (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC
dialogues.text: You just bought yourself a twenty dollar sparkler. The Mechanic leans in David's window... hands it to Amy. gingerly takes it.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Every day's the Fourth Of July at Small’s. The Mechanic rolls his eyes and motions to the sign.

dialogues.speaker: MECHANIC, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The owner makes me say that. (waves) Drive careful. Amy waves the sparkler out the window, as David pulls out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy grins, as she watches the sparkler shoot out the flam dots. It's not a smile we've seen from Amy, and David notices.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Guess I should go buy a box of sparklers, huh? Amy doesn't answer. Her smile fades with the sparks. She drops the charred black stick to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW cruises down the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David points ahead of them to the grove of trees and the road veering past them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW turns down the side road.  VACANCY 3-23-06 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy glances at the map, as David drives.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How far did he say this Westcliff place was?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He didn't. Suddenly, the car lurches forward a bit.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know. Did we hit something? Amy turns... there's nothing in the road.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I don't see anything. Another lurch... the engine skips.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What the hell? And now the engine more than skips, it dies. David pulls onto the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. David twists the ignition. The engine just turns over and over without starting.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch! So much for being able to keep driving it. David tries again... no luck.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! Amy pulls out her cell phone... holds it up... NO SIGNAL. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Nothing. David turns the key again... just that sickening groan.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Can't a car run without a fan?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Evidently not. David pounds the steering wheel and climbs out of the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW's hood is already up from where David has tried t work on the engine. David leans back under the hood.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Try it again.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It's not going to work. David taps at the engine with a PLASTIC TRAVEL MUG... he' mechanic.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How do you know? Jesus, just try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy leans over and turns the key, as she watches David po all over the engine with the handle of the mug. The engine WHIRRS over and over... doesn't start. David finally SLAMS THE MUG AGAINST THE ENGINE. The mug shatters.

dialogues.speaker: GODDAMMIT
dialogues.text: Amy almost smiles... she knew it.  VACANCY 3-23-06 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David kicks at the ground, grabs the remains of the mug a heaves them into the bushes. He looks up and down the road.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How far back was that station?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Five or six miles maybe. Too far to walk at night.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That means we sit here the rest of the night. Hope some idiots like us happen to drive down this stagecoach trail.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Idiot like you, not us. I didn't get us lost.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, you slept through five states thanks to your prozac/zoloft cocktail. Amy flips David off through the window. He walks out to t center of the road, and SCREAMS. A flock of startled birds burst from a tree... scatter up into the night sky. David sees something... walks a few yards down the road, lifts a TATTERED WOODEN SIGN from the high grass. Handpainted across it, "Prairie View Motel. One mile ahea David holds the sign up toward Amy in the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You feel like walking a mile?

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON DAVID AND AMY'S FEET...
dialogues.text: ...Walking along the black tar pavement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: move ahead, VACANCY 3-23-06 18. David gazes up at the star-filled sky.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I never see stars anymore. Not in L.A. (off their surroundings) Kind of nice out here really. I bet Charlie would've like it.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Should've brought him sometime. But we never went anywhere, remember? The job was always too important to leave.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Every time I mention his name, you take a shot at me.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Stop mentioning his name.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm not like you, Amy. I don't want to forget our son so the pain will go away.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Aren't you the brave one, David. Amy picks up her pace... leaves David behind. then veers off the road into a cluster of unzips and starts taking a piss.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Such a bitch. (louder, for Amy) Maybe you'd be happier if you tried talking about it, instead of acting like it never happened. Like Charlie never happened. The moon casts a bright glow over them as they make their down the road. He watches her (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amy just keeps walking. A few feet away from David, the BUSHES RATTLE. David squints toward the sound, but it's too dark and too overgrown to see what's in there. As he finishes up, the BUSHES RATTLE AGAIN... this time louder David throws another nervous glance into the bushes... st nothing. He leans closer... ...just as a RACCOON darts out of the brush past him. David leaps back, startled. He catches his breath as the animal scurries away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn raccoons are killing me. David turns... trots back toward the road after Amy. In the distance behind David, a FIGURE rises from the bus where David had just been. It's too far away to make out features. And the figure doesn't move... just watches Dav make his way down the road with Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Amy stand in the gravel parking lot, staring at beaten down roadside motel. Eight rooms stretched out in L-shape. The Bates Motel... in need of a paint job. A primer painted PICKUP TRUCK sits outside the office, un a "$19.00 A NIGHT" sign that hangs over the office screen door. Above that is a crooked "VACANCY" sign.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We could go back to the car. You could sleep on the hood and stare up at those stars you love so much.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Maybe they'll have a phone we can use. They start toward the motel office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BELL above the screen door JINGLES, as David and Amy en (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The tiny wood-paneled room has SEVERAL SECURITY VIDEO MONITORS on the walls behind the desk. The images of Davi and Amy entering the office fill the screens. Around the room, a few stock scenery pictures hanging on wall and a STUFFED JACK-A-LOPE, a rabbit with glued-on antlers, resting on the counter. At the rabbit's feet is DESK BELL, with a sign... "Ring Me". There's some MUFFLED 0.S. SCREAMING from the back room be the counter. David and Amy hear it... exchange a glance before David t the bell. There's some RUSTLING, then MASON, (40's), five foot nothing and hundred thirty pounds in his sweaty t-sh and jeans, appears from the back room.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Hey, folks. What can I do ya for?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (off the screams) Everything okay back there? Mason cocks his head, unsure. David motions to the back room. Mason grins and raises a TELEVISION REMOTE... hits button and the SCREAMS SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Gets a little boring around here late nights.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I bet so. Listen, our car broke down about a mile back. Just needed to borrow a phone... see if we could get a tow truck or something.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: All we've got is that pay phone outside. Mason points through the window to an OLD PHONE BOOTH alo the motel wall.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She works off dimes if you need some. David digs a dollar from his pocket. Mason takes it and trades it for a cluster of dimes from his drawer (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trouble is the only garage within ninety miles is Smalls. Little place on Route Six.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think we stopped there earlier.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: And Small's don't have a phone. David stares at Mason a beat, then down to the handful of dimes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So I probably don't need these then.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Not if you need a tow truck. David throws a glance to Amy before filling his pocket wi dimes.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I could run you back there in the morning if you want. Too late to do much right now no-ways. Amy looks at her watch... shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It's just a few hours.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. Guess we'll need one of those nineteen dollar rooms then. Mason nods... looks David and Amy over, then grins.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I can give you two the Honeymoon Suite for twenty-four. Got a few extras that the others don't.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's late. Regular room will do. Mason pulls a key from the hook behind him and slides it across the counter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: What the hell. I'll give it to ya for the same rate.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever. Thanks. David jerks out his credit card.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: 'Fraid we're not set up for plastic. Cash only.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do you take dimes? Mason grins... doesn't get the joke. David snaps a twenty from the wallet and reaches for the key. Mason pulls the back.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: And I need one of your ID's... sort of a deposit on the contents of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Trust me, we're not going to take anything. I'm not up to carrying dirty towels a mile down the road.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I'm sure you won't. But rules is rules. I don't make 'em. I'm just the manager. It's too late for this shit. David pulls out his driver's license... trades it to Mason for the key.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's the last one on the end there... number eight. Might have to jiggle the handle a bit to open her up. She's as sticky as an old whore. (to Amy) Excuse my language. Amy just turns and starts moving for the door.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a good night. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David waves over his shoulder as they walk out. Mason watches them head across the gravel lot, then turns disappears back into the back room. The 0.S. SCREAMS OF T HORROR FILM begin again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Until the door opens and Amy flips the light switch David and Amy stand frozen in the doorway. Because this is rough. Stained shag carpet. Torn FARM ANIMAL PRINT CURTAINS. Cigarette holes are burned into th paisley bedspread draped across the bed. Artificial plants hang in the corners of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good thing we upgraded. David closes the door... locks it and HOOKS THE CHAIN ACR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy enters and hits the light in the bathroom, illuminati the broken tile floor, rusty faucets and water-stained commode.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We've had our tetanus shots, right? Amy pulls a bottle of PILLS from her purse, shakes a coup into her palm. She turns on the faucet. BROWN WATER splashes out, gushing SEVERAL ROACHES out wit it. The bugs scurry around the sink Amy turns the water off... watches the bugs slither down drain. She tosses the pills into her mouth... gulps them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy walks out, sees David flipping through a TV GUIDE.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: If you want to know what shows were on during March of '97, I've got the answer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David tosses the old magazine back to the table. Amy move to the bed and pulls back the covers... inspects the shee

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm sleeping in my clothes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm sleeping in my shoes. David glances around the room... moves to the closet... p open the door. It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Could be worse I guess. We could still be jammed into that twin bed at your parents' house... trying to pretend we're the happy couple. Amy slides onto the bed... props herself against the wall not getting too comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We should have told them about us.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why ruin their party. We can tell them after we sign the papers. David climbs up beside Amy... stares at the farm print curtains.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What were you feeling... at the party... watching them celebrate being married all those years? A BEAT, then...

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Pity. A LONG, QUIET BEAT THIS TIME.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sorry about this. Should've stayed on the interstate.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Our one last great adventure together. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did we ever have great adventures? I don't remember. Amy doesn't answer... just wraps her coat a little tighte around herself.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: There had to be a couple. David leans closer... lightly kisses Amy's neck... up her skin toward her lips. Finally, Amy pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You really want to quit on us?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It hurts too much. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You can't just stop feeling because it hurts, Amy. Doesn't work that way.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That's all I can do. A KNOCK at the front door. David throws a pissed-off glan at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that? David goes to the door... pulls it open. No one is outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David leans out... checks both ways. Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hello? No answer.  VACANCY 3-23-06 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You heard that, right? Amy nods. Then ANOTHER KNOCK... this one down the wall... from the ADJOINING ROOM DOOR. David moves to the side door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah? MORE KNOCKS. David throws Amy a glance, then reaches to unbolt the loc

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: David, wait.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's the room beside us.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I know. Hang ona... But David turns the bolt. The door swings open... ...and there's nothing but ANOTHER DOOR behind it. The ot room's door. No door handle for David to grab. The KNOCKING CONTINUES. David pounds back against their side of the partition.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you need? The knocking stops.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? (to Amy) Were there any cars when we walked over? Amy goes to the window... squints outside. Just the OLD PICKUP TRUCK sitting outside the office. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: There's a truck. Probably the office guy's. David taps on the door

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Whoever's in there, it's too late for this shit. Then the other room's door begins to SHAKE... like whoeve on the other side is jerking hard on the handle.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell is this?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Close the door, David. David just keeps watching the door vibrate.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close the door! Amy pushes past David and SLAMS THEIR DOOR CLOSED. She bo it back secure.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus! Why mess with them?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm not messing with them. I just want to know what they're doing. LOUD KNOCKS AT THE FRONT DOOR spin David and Amy. They exchange a glance, then David goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who is it? No answer. David secures the chain across the door, then eases it open... peers out through the crack. As Amy watches him, a POUNDING ERUPTS from the door besid her. She jumps with a start... backs away from it. David BEATS AGAINST THE WALL WITH HIS FIST.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's your problem, asshole! The KNOCKING GETS LOUDER. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Screw this. David scans the room for a phone... there isn't one. He pushes back a desk... an empty phone jack sits in the wal

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perfect. David starts out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: David, wait. But David's too mad to wait. He stomps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David goes to the adjacent door... ROOM NUMBER SEVEN. He bangs on the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Open the door! No answer. David beats on it again.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. You want to play games, lets play. David jerks on the handle... locked. He knocks again, and this time a KNOCKING answers him. Just like in the room.. slow, steady KNOCKING. David peers in the dark window... can't see who's behind door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Real funny, jerkoff. David turns to Amy in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: To go shut this prick up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David starts across the lot to the motel office. Amy disappears behind the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy bolts the door... pulls the rusty chain across. She checks the lock on the adjoining room door, then hurries the window... watches David walk into the motel office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David smacks the bell between the Jack-a-lope's feet over over. Mason leans out of the back room.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Everything all right, Mr. Fox?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. The asshole in the room beside us keeps banging on the walls. He won't stop.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Beside you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Room seven. I went over to talk to him, but he just kept doing it. I don't know what his problem is.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: That's strange. Mason turns to the RACK OF KEYS hanging behind the counte Key Number Seven is still there.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're the only guests we got tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well somebody's in there.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You're sure it was number seven? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're the last one and we're eight right? It's right beside us, with a big, rusty seven on the door, so I'm pretty sure, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Okay, I got ya. Every once a blue moon some drifter or college kids'1l crawl through a window for a night's sleep. Cleanin' lady'll find some trash layin' around... shit in the toilet. Don't usually cause no disturbance though.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well this one is. Mason considers this a moment, then grabs the key.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I'll check her out for ya. David notices a PISTOL tucked on a shelf behind the count

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: If that works, you might think about bringing that. Mason grins... picks up the pistol and twirls it like a gunfighter.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I'm ass-tired of just shootin' at crows.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good hunting.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. Fox. David walks out. Mason does a few more twirls with the gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David strides out of the office, back into the darkness. sees Amy peering out between the curtains. David waves.  VACANCY 3-23-06 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy unlatches the door... opens it. David enters.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thinks it's just some drunk. He's going to take care of it. David closes the door... locks it back

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you hear anything else?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. I was almost wishing I would, so I'd know where they were.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Probably saw me heading for the office and took off. (glances around) Now we can enjoy this luxury resort with some peace and quiet. David gives the adjoining room door a smack, then falls o the bed.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just leave. Go back to the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm not walking anymore. Let's just gut it out for a few hours and catch a ride back. We'll get the car fixed and get the hell out. Amy doesn't like it, but just shrugs... sits down on the beside David. David grabs the remote.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You're not going to watch that now? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Just for a little while. Until we know our friend's gone from over there. Besides, gotta take advantage of the Honeymoon Suite perk. Worth at least an extra five bucks. David flips the television on... STATIC. He dances throug the channels... nothing but more static.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe not.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: The manager guy... he's going over there for sure, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: With his six-shooter. He'll take care of it. Gotta keep his only two guests happy. David notices a VCR with SEVERAL VIDEO TAPES stacked on t of it. He grabs a tape... no label.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bet this is a library of classics. David slips the tape into the VCR. The onscreen static disappears, replaced by footage from BUDGET SLASHER FILM... grainy picture... hollow sound. THREE MEN, stripped down to their underwear, are in a sma room, TIED ON THE FLOOR. TWO SHADOWY FIGURES stand over t men. The three men are MOANING... BEGGING to the figures. Suddenly one of the figures raises a KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: David's face... grimacing, as we hear the MAN'S SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jesus. The perfect movie to put newlyweds in the mood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Turn it off. I hate those kind of films. And that's the last thing I need right now. David pops the tape out... replaces it with another.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They should at least give you a little porn. The screen flashes on again... this time there are THREE COLLEGE GIRLS huddled on a bed. It's the same small room, and the camera angle is just as last... looking down on the girls as they tremble and cry One of the girls SCREAMS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE
dialogues.text: And a figure steps into the frame. The girls start flaili at him. Another figure steps into the picture. One of the figures drags a girl to the floor and starts tearing at h clothes.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: God, at least mute it or something so I don't have to hear that. But David isn't listening, because he's noticed something He moves closer to the screen... his reflection fills the glass, as he stares at the CURTAINS IN THE ONSCREEN ROOM. They're designed in a FARM ANIMAL PRINT... just like the in their room. David studies their curtains a beat, then looks back to t screen... watches as the attacker raises his blade over t girl lying on the GOLD SHAG CARPET. TIGHT ON DAVID'S FACE... ...frightened. His eyes dart down to his feet... ...to the REDDISH STAIN ON THE GOLD SHAG CARPET.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I told you to turn it off. David turns... glances around the room.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it? The girls' SCREAMS burst out from the tv. David's nervous and Amy sees it.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Look at that room... in the movie. Amy stares at the screen... watches a figure throw one of girls onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What about it? Then Amy focuses on the PAISLEY BEDSPREAD. She looks down at the identical bedspread underneath her. Her eyes jump back to the screen. ANGLE ON THE SCREEN... ...and a girl trying to escape one of the figures... craw off the bed... knocking off the CACTUS SHAPED LAMP. The l tumbles onto the bed. Amy glances beside her... to the CACTUS SHAPED LAMP. Her face washes pale.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What movie is that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know. David eyes one of the hanging plants. He grabs a chair an slides it over... stands up on the chair and pulls the du plant back. THERE'S A VIDEO CAMERA AIMED RIGHT AT HIM... its RED LIGH BLINKING. The girls keep SCREAMING from the television. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David's frozen... just stares back at the camera. Amy wan to scream, but has suddenly forgotten how. David stumbles back off the chair, his eyes still locked the video camera.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: David. David doesn't answer. Amy glances back to the camera, the points to the tv.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is that this room?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It looks like it. David walks across the room... reaches up and swings the other hanging plant. ANOTHER CAMERA IS SECURED TO THE WALL BEHIND IT.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: This is some kind of joke, right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know. They exchange a glance, then turn back to the tv... one o the figures swings the knife toward one of the girls. Amy takes a step back, almost as if she's afraid the figu going to come right out of the screen at them.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: They can't really be killing those girls. That can't be real. Amy ejects the girls' video tape and slides in another. The screen is filled with the same room... THEIR ROOM. An it's empty... until the door swings open, and an OLD COUP charge through the door, slam it closed. The OLD WOMAN is CRYING. The OLD MAN looks around in a panic. They hold each other, and stare at the door. As they do, one of the same figures steps out of the bath door behind them. They don't see him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn around. The figure eases up behind the couple.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turn around! The figure raises a knife.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! As the attacker swings the knife down, the tv goes blank. THE ROOM FALLS INTO TOTAL DARKNESS... silence. The power' been turned off. David and Amy stand frozen in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened? David fumbles through the dark... reaches the light switc it doesn't work. Amy twists the knob on the lamp... nothi And then THE SOFT KNOCKING AT THE WALL RETURNS.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, God. David?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's okay. David and Amy huddle together at the center of the room, staring through the darkness toward the knocking. A LOUDER KNOCK AT THE DOOR... the door handle shakes. David and Amy freeze... don't even breathe. David puts hi finger over his lips... the room is silent. AND THEN THE POWER FLASHES BACK ON... the room lights up. the television flickers back on... the old couple SCREAMS ONSCREEN. David and Amy's eyes jump to the tv... shit. They look to the door... the SHAKING IS MORE VIOLENT. David and Amy take a few steps back away from the door eyeing the door handle... the RUSTY CHAIN that latches th door locked. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The SCREAMS KEEP COMING FROM THE TV. Amy suddenly remembe the video... spins around, looking for the figure to step behind them. No one's there. Suddenly, the power goes out again, sending the room back into dark silence. David grabs the cactus lamp off the table, ready to swing They back against the wall... slide down to the floor The THUMPING ON THE ADJOINING DOOR BEGINS AGAIN... the li go dark, then burst back on, then off again... repeating a strobe... flashes of screams erupt from the television couple each time it restarts. And then with each flash of light, a FIGURE BECOMES VISIBLE... standing frozen just inside the bathroom doorw He doesn't move... just stands there, filling the doorway only a few feet away from David and Amy. David and Amy don't see him... just stay huddled against wall. The pounding grows louder... the shakes on the door handl harder... the flashes of light over the figure come faste Then suddenly everything falls still. The lights turn on, the thumping stops, the door handle isn't moving, and the figure IS GONE FROM THE DOORWAY. David places the lamp back on the table, scrambles over t the tv and turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I'm calling the police. Amy pulls out her cell phone... flips it on. NO SIGNAL... she forgot.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. No signal.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We have to get out of here. Amy starts for the door. David grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoever was out there had to hear the tv. That means they know we watched it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: That asshole put us in here to watch it. He wasn't going to help us, David. He's part of this.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So they know we watched it, and now they know we're going to run. They'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Maybe he won't know that we caught on... that we recognized anything. David turns... stares up at the camera... the red light blinking... watching them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He knows.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So what then? David leans into the bathroom... sees a WINDOW in the bac wall.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We climb out that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David hurries to the window... turns the handle... it doe budge. He pulls on the crank... it starts to turn, but th stops. David sees the NAILS HAMMERED INTO THE WINDOWSILL holding it shut... it won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit! David starts banging against the window to jar it free.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Somebody's going to hear you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So what do we do then?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We go out the door, and we run... make it back to that gas station. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You think they're just going to let us stroll out of here, so we can go tell the police what we found?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: They're not going to just let us sit in here either, David. David makes another desperate turn with the window handle no luck.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit! David hurries out of the bathroom. Amy starts after him, then stops... because she's just noticed something restin the sink. HER HALF-EATEN APPLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy walks out, carrying the apple. David's looking around trying to come up with a plan.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Did you bring this?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Did you get this when we left the car?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: It was in there. On the sink. I didn't bring it either.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You had to. You probably stuck it in your pocket and just forgot.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I bled all over it, remember. Then I threw it in the bag. There's no way I brought it. I left it in the car, David. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They hold a long look. Amy's about to cry.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's happening? David walks into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David enters... glances around the room. His eyes hold on the tub... its shower curtain extended, hiding whatever m be behind it. Amy walks in behind him. David grabs one of the dirty glasses from the sink, grips like a baseball, then JERKS THE SHOWER CURTAIN OPEN. The shower rod pulls free from the wall and crashes down. and the tub's empty.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How'd it get in here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David walks out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Turn off the lights.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're leaving. Amy hits the lights... the room goes dark. Their shadows move about the room. David goes to the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: AS soon as we get outside, we run to the trees, okay... get out of the open where they can't see us. And we've got to move fast, Amy.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Try to keep up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David peers out through the farm animal curtains again. The moonlight shines over the empty gravel lot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't see anybody. David moves to the door... removes the chain... slowly op the door and peers outside. He reaches his hand out to Am She takes it... probably the first time they've held each other in months. David and Amy slip out the door together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Amy ease out the door... press their backs agai the wall of the motel, to stay tucked in the shadows. David points across the road, toward a thick forest of tr

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (whispering) Over there. You ready? Amy nods... one last glance around, and they take off... sprint across the lot, hand in hand. They race across the road... down a grassy slope... charg toward the dark safety of the trees. But then A MAN, (KILLER ONE), a shadow with eyes, APPEARS FROM THE TREES.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: David! Amy slides to a stop, pulling David with her. They squint toward the man, as he moves up from the trees.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: C'mon. This way. David pulls Amy back toward the road. As they run, they see a SECOND SHADOWY MAN, (KILLER TWO), standing in the distance, blocking their escape. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. They spin back the other direction, but Killer One is cut them off... striding down the center of the road toward t

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: David, it's them.

dialogues.speaker: GET AWAY FROM US
dialogues.text: But the men just keep closing methodically in, tightening angle around David and Amy. They have nowhere else to go back toward the motel.

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: David and Amy turn and sprint back across the road... cha toward their motel room. Amy throws a glance back toward figures. The men move calmly after them... converging... following

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: They're coming! As Amy runs, her CELL PHONE falls from her pocket and cra to the gravel. Amy sees it, but knows she can't go back.. they continue on... reach the door... David grabs the han and pushes... the door doesn't move. The two figures close in. They're in no hurry. ANGLE ON KILLER ONE'S FOOT... ...Stepping down onto Amy's cell phone... crushing it. David keeps pushing against the door

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Open it, David!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm trying!

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Shake it! The guy said to... David nearly shakes the handle off the door. Finally, it flies open.  VACANCY 3-23-06 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Amy pour into the room. David slams the door sh behind them, turns the bolt and pulls the chain back acro David and Amy back away from the door, looking eerily sim to the old couple they watched on the video. 0.S. FOOTSTEPS... heavy feet on gravel... growing louder. closer. David and Amy stare at the door, waiting... dreading. The SOFT CLICKING AT THE DOOR... like fingernails tapping at wood. The CLICKING TURNS TO CLAWING... long, slow scratches dow the door. Then the door THUMPS, like someone has just pressed their weight against it David throws his body against the door, holding it secure The THUMPING GROWS HARDER. David begins to jerk from the pounding.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (whispering) Get the window open. In the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: David?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'll be right behind you. And don't turn on the light. Amy races into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy doesn't turn on the light. Climbs onto the commode to reach the small window. She pulls on the handle with all strength. The handle pops off its stem... falls to the floor. Amy jumps down to retrieve the handle... raises back up t slide it back on, AND THERE'S KILLER TWO AT THE WINDOW. Amy stumbles backward... falls into the wall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Killer Two stares in at Amy. Amy spins out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy hurries back in with David. He's still pressed agains the door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: They're out there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: At the window! The door keeps shaking from the beating it's taking outsi

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I've got a gun! Get away or I swear to God I'll kill you! THE THUMPING AGAINST THE DOOR SUDDENLY STOPS. The world g quiet. David doesn't dare step away, but he throws Amy a glance... Did it work? And then the room erupts with POUNDING... like clubs beat against the door and windows. Amy throws her hands over her ears... backs into the corn

dialogues.speaker: LEAVE US ALONE
dialogues.text: The pounding continues, then dies away. The room goes sil again. Amy slides down the wall to the floor. David listens... doesn't hear anything. He peers out through the peephole. DAVID'S POV... ...through the peephole. A stretched, magnified image of dark, empty lot. No one's there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't see them.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why would they just leave?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How many of them are there?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: At least two. David moves to the adjoining room door... pulls their doo open and starts shoving against the next door

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Wait! They were over there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: And there's nothing stopping them from coming in after us if that's what they want. So we've got to find another way out of here. David rams his shoulder against the door. It doesn't budg He hurries into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David rushes to the window... peers outside. A FIGURE FLASHES PAST... disappears into the cluster of t behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David walks back to the front window... slides the curtai open just a crack. DAVID'S POV ON THE PARKING LOT... ...empty... quiet. No sign of anyone. Then our POV pans over to the old PAY PHONE standing acro the lot against the motel wall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID...
dialogues.text: ...Stares at the phone a beat, then slides away from the window. He digs those dimes out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I need to get to that phone.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's a real phone. It'll have to work.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You're not going to get to it, David. They're not going to let you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay, Amy, then we just sit here. End up like all of them. David motions to the television.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I saw somebody out back. Like they were watching the window. If we can keep their attention on that it might give me a chance to get to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How do we do that? David throws Amy a look... she's not going to like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy stands at the window, nervously pulling at the handle like she's trying to get it open. She scrapes her fingernails across the painted seams. Killer One darts past in the trees. Amy closes her eyes... trembles... tries to pretend no on out there, as she continues working on the window... trie keep their attention. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: (whispers) Please hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honeymoon Suite door cracks open... David peers out.. all clear. He slips out the door... ducks in the shadows, near the corner of the building. He scans the area... there's a cluster of OIL DRUMS about halfway between Davi and the phone. David takes off... sprints over the gravel, then ducks do at the center of the oil drums. He turns in a circle, checking out all sides. Still clear. He eyes the phone a moment, then notices a VIDEO CAMERA hanging from the corner of the building. Another camera is attached at the other end of the buildi aimed at the parking lot. David stares back at them, then takes a breath and darts toward the phone booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David hurries inside... starts to pull the door closed, b that sends the CEILING LIGHT FLASHING ON. David shoves th door back open... the phone booth goes dark again. He grabs the receiver, stretching cobwebs out from the ol phone. He shoves the dimes into the slot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy continues chipping away at the sealed window. Suddenly, Killer One appears just outside... presses his against the glass. Amy SCREAMS... stumbles back out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David dials 911... glances around the empty lot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (whispering) Come on. A V.O. RINGING, then...

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: 911 Emergency. David presses himself against the cracked phone booth gla to muffle his voice.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We need help. Some people are trying to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Where are you located, sir?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: My wife and I, we're at this motel... the Prairie View Motel. It's near the mountains. They've got us trapped here.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Who has you trapped, sir?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don't know. We just need someone to help us. It's the Prairie View Motel.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yes sir, you said that. Do you have an address?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What? No. It's on some side road. Jesus Christ, look it up.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You need to settle down. You'll never survive if you lose control, Mr. Fox.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you talking... And then David freezes... stares at the phone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And you shouldn't be wandering around in the dark by yourself. Suddenly BRIGHT LIGHTS WASH OVER DAVID. He spins... to th headlights of his BMW blinding him. The car's racing off road... blasting across the motel lot toward David.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's just not safe. David drops the phone and dives out of the phone booth... just as the BMW SMASHES INTO THE PHONE BOOTH, shattering glass, and sending it flying through the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy hears the crash... rushes to the window in time to se the BMW backing away from demolished phone booth... and D scrambling to his feet... sprinting back across the lot.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: David!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW's tires spin in the gravel, as it reverses course takes aim at David. David sprints across the lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy stands at the window, watching David race from the ca

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Run, David. RUN! Amy rushes to the door. Swings it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David charges toward Amy... toward the open door... to hi safety. The BMW SPEEDS UP... gains fast on David... its crushed smoking front end steams down David's back. And David doesn't dare look back... just keeps heading fo that door.

dialogues.speaker: RUN, DAVID
dialogues.text: The BMW lurches forward... is about to pull David under, David reaches the door... dives inside. The BMW veers away, skidding across the lot, tossing grav into the room at David and Amy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy slams the door closed... locks it, and falls onto Dav holding him... kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Don't leave me again. Please don't ever leave me. David wraps his arms around her... holds her against him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I won't. I promise. A CAR HORN BLARES OUTSIDE, separating them. They go to th window... see the BMW sitting outside, its headlights flashing at them... taunting them.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Did you get anybody on the phone?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: So what do we do now? The BMW backs up... tears out of the lot and around the b of the motel office. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's going to be light in a few hours. They'll want this to be over by then. David glances around the room.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We need something. Do you have some scissors... anything? Amy digs through her purse. Shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about the knife? The one with the apple?

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: In the car. David throws open some drawers... nothing but a BIBLE. He walks to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David checks the drawers... tugs at the shower head pipe. there's nothing. He stares at his reflection in the mirro then SLAMS HIS FIST INTO THE MIRROR. The mirror shatters... jagged shards of glass rain down o the sink. David grabs a washcloth, and lifts a large, dagger-like p of mirror. He grips it like a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David walks out... waves his new weapon at Amy and shrugs

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Best I could do. David joins Amy. They slide down the wall to the floor. A notices David's bleeding hand.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You cut yourself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Let's hope that's as bad as it gets. Amy snuggles closer against David. They sit together in t darkness... staring at the door

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are they doing? David glances up to the video camera, aimed toward them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They're enjoying themselves. We pull back away from David and Amy... back up toward th camera... farther... into the camera. David and Amy grow smaller... then darkness takes over for a moment... ...until we see David and Amy again... this time they're with a green glow, like we're watching them through nightvision goggles. And we pull back farther... realize the image is on a VID MONITOR... we drift back even more... past the head of a watching the screen. The man presses a keyboard button... the image zooms in t on Amy's frightened face. He reaches up... runs a finger along the screen... over her face. An 0.S. DOOR OPENING. The man turns and for the first tim we see his face... it's Mason. And he looks very pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Amy sitting against the wall, her closed eyes fluttering... her head slowly drifting forward... falling asleep. Suddenly a WOMAN'S 0.S. SCREAM snaps Amy's head back up. eyes fly open. She looks around in a sleepy panic... ...sees David at the television, watching one of the vide tapes... the old couple being attacked by the figure.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: You let me fall asleep! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Just for a minute. You're exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: No. I want to be awake. Amy starts to move over beside David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I need you to stay there.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What? David points to a TINY BLACK WINDOW hidden in the wall directly across from Amy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They're watching you. Amy glances up to the corner cameras. There are towels hanging over them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I didn't want them to watch what I was doing. But they have to see you... know that we're not trying to get out. Amy looks back to the two-inch black window. She pulls he knees up against her chest.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Going through the tapes. David fast forwards the tape... ...it jumps along to shots of an OLD COUPLE racing around room in a panic... into the bathroom... back out... crouc down in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They've got cameras everywhere. Even outside. Then they edit them together to make their own snuff films. Remember the screaming we heard... from the tv that guy was watching in the office? (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: (off Amy's nod) I'm sure it was one of these. It's not enough to just rob and kill people. They want to watch it too.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Why are you watching them?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm looking for mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What kind of mistakes?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Any kind that might save our lives. The other people... they weren't smart.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: They were scared. Just like we are.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. And they just stayed in here like this room would protect them. It won't. They can come in anytime they want. David motions to the screen... to the figure continuing h attack on the old couple. Suddenly, the image starts skipping back, as David rewinds the tape... the couple wa backward... crouches down in the corner of the room. Then David presses the button... the image starts playing ...V.0. BANGING ON THE DOOR. The couple jumps up, rushes the door to hold it shut. As they do, the figure steps ou of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They just wait until they get bored watching. David freezes the image... points to it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's happened in almost every one of these. He just shows up.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: How does that help us?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How'd he get in here? He wasn't inside before. David replays the tape again... the old couple moving abo the room... sliding down into the corner... rushing to th door... the figure appearing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And he didn't come through that door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I couldn't tell in the others, but the angle with this one... it's the bathroom. (beat) And that's where your apple came from. David moves to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stay there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David enters, closing the door behind him. He hangs a tow over the window, blocking any view from outside. He flips on the light... his eyes scan over the room, searching... until they settle on a MISSING TILE in the shower. ANOTHER CAMERA. David lifts the shower curtain back up, obstructing its v Then he starts moving around, tugging on the commode, run his hands along the walls, looking for seams. He turns in a tight circle, studying the ceiling. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And then a SQUEAK from under David's feet. He looks down the RUG he's standing on. He steps off... slides the rug away... and there's a TRAP DOOR IN THE FLOOR. David starts to tug it open, then...

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: David! David hurries back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David rushes out of the bathroom... sees Amy still sittin the floor, and pointing out the window.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: I saw lights. And now we hear the 0.S. RUMBLE OF AN ENGINE. David and Amy rush to the window. Amy inches the curtains open. A BEER DELIVERY TRUCK pulls up outside the motel office.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Someone's here. They watch the truck grind to a stop. Amy starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Wait. We don't know who he is.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: He's a ride out of this place.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Unless he's one of them. What's he doing here so late? David and Amy watch the DRIVER climb down out of the truc

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: Maybe he's lost. That could happen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amy gives David a look... couldn't it? They stand at the window, watching the driver step down o of the truck... pop the cricks out of his neck.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He looks like he's been driving a long time. He's not one of them, David. And then the Driver notices them standing in the window. They hold a look, until David raises his hand... just a bit... gives the driver the slightest wave. The driver glances around, a little confused, before returning it.

dialogues.speaker: AMY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He can help us. Amy starts for the door again, but David grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You can't go out there. So Amy just starts waving both arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver stands by his truck, watching David and Amy fl wildly at their window. He can't hear anything over the RUMBLE OF HIS TRUCK'S ENGINE. He throws another glance around the empty, dark lot, then starts toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Amy see the driver approaching.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: He's coming.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They won't let him. He needs to drive the truck over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: David motions to the truck. The driver doesn't understand keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have to tell him. David starts for the door, until...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Amy's staring horrified out the window. David peers back out... to the driver halfway across the lot... ...to KILLER ONE AND KILLER TWO CLOSING IN ON HIM FROM TH SHADOWS BEHIND.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. NOOO! David and Amy start swinging their arms... pounding the window... pointing and yelling for the driver to turn aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver still can't hear anything but his engine... doesn't look back... just keeps walking toward David and going crazy in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David beats against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: THEY'RE BEHIND YOU
dialogues.text: But the driver doesn't even flinch... he can't hear him. David and Amy watch as Killer One and Killer Two near the driver... ten feet... five... the KNIVES GLISTENING IN TH HANDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver continues toward them... no more than twenty y from their window. Then... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey! The truck driver turns... sees Mason trotting toward him, holding out a VIDEO TAPE.

dialogues.speaker: MASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here ya go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Amy watch as the driver starts to Mason, and Ki One and Killer Two continue right past him... right towar David and Amy. The driver takes the tape from Mason... shoves Mason a WA CASH in return. Then the driver turns... looks right at David and Amy... SMILES. David and Amy stare back at him in shock... watch as Kill One and Killer Two continue approaching. Amy begins to cry... she knows it's over. David snaps the curtains closed, blocking the killers' view inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Come on! David pulls Amy to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David shoves Amy toward the hole in the floor

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Go.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: JUST GO
dialogues.text: Amy slides down into the hole. David follows her, then pu the trap door back over the hole, sealing it.  VACANCY 3-23-06 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 6 x 6 dirt box. Nothing but the trap door in the ceilin and a small, sewer pipe-sized dirt tunnel leading out. David and Amy frantically feel over the walls, searching another exit. There isn't one. Just that tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: AMY
dialogues.text: We can't go in that, David. We don't know what’s in there. 0.S. FOOTSTEPS ABOVE THEM. David looks up to the sound, t back to that narrow tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We don't have any choice. David takes Amy's hand... eases her toward the mouth of t tunnel. Amy shakes her head... holds firm.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Baby, we have to. Come on, I'll lead you. David squeezes into the tunnel... dirt falls over him, as crawls deeper. Amy sticks just her upper body in the hole

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, dank and claustrophobic... hand-dug through the ear There’s just enough room for them to slide on their stoma David tries to look back to Amy, but it's so tight he can even turn his head to her. This is what it feels like to be buried alive.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Come on, Amy. It's gonna be okay. Amy watches David's feet slide further into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's gonna lead us out of here. MORE STOMPING ABOVE AMY. She flinches at the sound, and i enough to send her squirming into the tunnel after David.  VACANCY 3-23-06 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dirt walls of the tunnel squeeze their bodies as they crawl... rocks and underground vines jut out of the earth David drags himself along the seemingly endless black hol Nothing but darkness ahead of them... at least that's all they can see.
